answerText: "i sing of Olaf glad and big"[10] "i sing of Olaf glad and big" is a poem by this American who also wrote The Enormous Room and "anyone lived in a pretty how town."
heading: NASAT |2013 | 3 | 6 | Literature | American | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: This poem describes a "conscientious object-or" whose "warmest heart recoiled at war," for which he is thrown into a dungeon to die. For 10 points each: [10] Name this poem whose title character was "more brave than me" and "more blond than you."
